It is characterized by its delicate, lace-like fronds that emit a faint, golden glow under certain light conditions. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat requirements, Lepidostephanus is considered a rare and endangered species.
